00037 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00038 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00039 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00040    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00041    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept them, but uses a dedicated
00042    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00043 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00044 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00046 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00048 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ 4096
00049 
00050 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00051 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00052 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00053 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00055 #define xnarch_alloc_stack xnmalloc
00056 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00058 struct xnthread;
00059 struct task_struct;
00060 
00061 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00062 
00063     /* Kernel mode side */
00064     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00065     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00066     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00067     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00068     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00069 
00070     /* User mode side */
00071     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00072     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00073 
00074     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00075     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00076     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00077 
00078 } xnarchtcb_t;
00079 
00080 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00081 
00082     unsigned vector;
00083     long errcode;
00084     struct pt_regs *regs;
00085 
00086 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00087 
00088 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00091 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  ((fi)->vector == 7)
00093 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00094    Linux stack context. */
00095 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00096                                  ((fi)->vector != 1 && (fi)->vector != 3))
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->vector == 14)

00103 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00104 
00105 {
00106     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00107         return vmalloc(bytes);
00108 
00109     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00110 }
00111 
00112 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00113 
00114 {
00115     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00116         vfree(chunk);
00117     else
00118         kfree(chunk);
00119 }

00121 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00122 {
00123     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00124 }

00126 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00127 
00128 {
00129     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00130 }

00138 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00139                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00140     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00142 
00143 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00144 
00145 {
00146     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00147 
00148     adeos_load_cpuid();
00149 
00150     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00151        and always inside a critical section. */
00152     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00153     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00154     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00155     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00156     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00157 }
00158 
00159 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00160 {
00161     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162 }
00163 
00164 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00165                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00166                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00167                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00168                                     )
00169 {
00170 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00171 
00172     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00173         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00174         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00175         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00176         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00177         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00178         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00179         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00180         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00181         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00182         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00183         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00184         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00185         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00186         "ret\n\t" \
00187 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00188         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00189         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00190       : /* no output */ \
00191       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00192         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00193         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00194         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00195         "b" (out_tcb), \
00196         "S" (in_tcb), \
00197         "a" (outproc), \
00198         "d" (inproc));
00199 
00200 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00201 
00202     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00203     
00204     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00205         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00206         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00207         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00208         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00209         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00210         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00211         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00212         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00213         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00214         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00215         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00216         "ret\n\t" \
00217 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00218       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00219         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00220         "=S" (esi_out), \
00221         "=D" (edi_out), \
00222         "+a" (outproc), \
00223         "+d" (inproc) \
00224       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00225         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00226         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00227         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00228 
00229 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00230 }
00231 
00232 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00233                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00234 {
00235     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00236     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00237 
00238     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00239         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00240            clear the ts bit. */
00241         clts();
00242     
00243     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00244 
00245     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00246         {
00247         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00248 
00249         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00250 
00251         if (!inproc->mm)
00252             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00253         }
00254 
00255     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00256 
00257     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00258 
00259         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00260            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00261            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00262            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00263            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00264            raw I/O ops. */
00265 
00266         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00267 
00268         barrier();
00269 
00270         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00271             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00272 
00273             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00274                 
00275                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00276 
00277                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00278                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00279                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00280                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00281 
00282                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00283                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00284             }
00285         }
00286     }
00287 
00288     stts();
00289 }
00290 
00291 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00292                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00293 {
00294     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00298 {
00299     /* Empty */
00300 }
00301 
00302 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00303                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00304                                          const char *name)
00305 {
00306     tcb->user_task = current;
00307     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00308     tcb->esp = 0;
00309     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00310     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00311     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00312 }
00313 
00314 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00315                                                int imask,
00316                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00317                                                void *cookie)
00318 {
00319     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00320     stts();
00321     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00322     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00323     entry(cookie);
00324     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00325 }
00326 
00327 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00328                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00329                                        void *cookie,
00330                                        int imask,
00331                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00332                                        char *name)
00333 {
00334     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00335 
00336     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00337     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00338     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00339     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00340     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00341     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00342     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00343     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00344     *--(*psp) = 0;
00345 }
00346 
00347 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00348 
00349 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00350 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   ((task)->used_math)
00351 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) ((task)->used_math = 1)
00352 #else
00353 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   tsk_used_math(task)
00354 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) set_stopped_child_used_math(task)
00355 #endif
00356 
00357 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00358 
00359 {
00360     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00361     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00362        task. */
00363 
00364     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00365 
00366     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00367         {
00368         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00369         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00370         }
00371 
00372     if(task)
00373         {
00374         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00375           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00376           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00377         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00378         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00379         }   
00380 }
00381 
00382 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00383 
00384 {
00385     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00386     
00387     if(task)
00388         {
00389         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00390             return;
00391 
00392         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00393            of this task. */
00394         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00395         }
00396 
00397     clts();
00398     
00399     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00400         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00401     else
00402         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00403 }
00404 
00405 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00406 
00407 {
00408     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00409 
00410     if (task)
00411         {
00412         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00413             {
00414             stts();
00415             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00416             }
00417 
00418         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00419            hardware. */
00420         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00421         }
00422 
00423     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00424        user-space or kernel thread. */
00425     clts();
00426 
00427     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00428         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00429     else
00430         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00431 }
00432 
00433 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00434 
00435 {
00436     clts();
00437 
00438     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00439     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00440        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00441         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00442 }
00443 
00444 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00445 
00446 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00447 
00448 {}
00449 
00450 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00451 
00452 {}
00453 
00454 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00455 
00456 {}
00457 
00458 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00459 
00460 {}
00461 
00462 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */

00466 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00467 
00468     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00469 }
00470 
00471 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00472 
00473 {
00474     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00475                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00476                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00477                                      NULL,
00478                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00479 }
00480 
00481 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00482 
00483 {
00484     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00485                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00486                                      NULL,
00487                                      NULL,
00488                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00489 }
00490 
00491 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00492 
00493 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00494 {
00495     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00496 }
00497 
00498 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00499     
00500 {
00501     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00502     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00503     unsigned long flags;
00504     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00505 
00506     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00507 
00508     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00509        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00510        context. */
00511     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00512                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00513 
00514     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00515     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00516     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00517     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00518 
00519     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00520         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00521     
00522     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00523                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00524 }
00525 
00526 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00527 
00528 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00529 
00530     return 0;
00531 }
00532 
00533 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00534 
00535     return 0;
00536 }
00537 
00538 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00539 
00540     return 0;
00541 }
00542 
00543 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00544 
00545 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00546 
00547 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00548 
00549 {
00550 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00551     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00552        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00553     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00554 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00555 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00556     xnshadow_release_events();
00557 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00558     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00559     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00560     schedule_timeout(50);
00561     xnarch_release_ipi();
00562 }
00563 
00564 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00565 
00566 {
00567     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00568 
00569     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00570         {
00571         spl_t s;
00572         splsync(s);
00573         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00574         splexit(s);
00575         return 1;
00576         }
00577 
00578     return 0;
00579 }
00580 
00581 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00582 
00583 {
00584 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00585     xnshadow_grab_events();
00586 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00587 }

00589 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00591 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00592 
00593 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00594 {
00595     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00596     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00597     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00598     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00599     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00600     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00601 }
00602 
00603 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00604 
00605 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00606 
00607 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00608                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00609                                            const char *name)
00610 {
00611     struct task_struct *task = current;
00612 
00613     tcb->user_task = task;
00614     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00615     tcb->esp = 0;
00616     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00617     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00618     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00619 }
00620 
00621 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00622 
00623 {
00624     unsigned irq;
00625 
00626     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00627         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00628                              handler,
00629                              NULL,
00630                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00631 }
00632 
00633 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00634 
00635 {
00636     unsigned irq;
00637 
00638     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00639         {
00640         switch (irq)
00641             {
00642 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00643             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00644             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00645             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00646             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00647 
00648                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00649                 continue;
00650 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00651 
00652             default:
00653 
00654                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00655             }
00656         }
00657 }
00658 
00659 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00660 
00661 {
00662     unsigned irq;
00663 
00664     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00665         {
00666         switch (irq)
00667             {
00668 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00669             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00670             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00671             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00672             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00673 
00674                 continue;
00675 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00676 
00677             default:
00678 
00679                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00680             }
00681         }
00682 }
00683 
00684 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00685 
00686 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00687 
00688 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00689     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00690        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00691        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00692        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00693     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00694 }
00695 
00696 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00697     rthal_timer_release();
00698 }
00699 
00700 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00701 
00702 {
00703 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00704     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00705 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00706     return 0;
00707 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00708 }
00709 
00710 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00711 
00712 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00713 
00714 #include <linux/init.h>
00715 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00716 
00717 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00718 
00719 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00720 
00721 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00722 
00723 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00724 
00725 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00726 
00727 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00728 
00729 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00730 {
00731     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00732 
00733     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00734     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00735     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00736 
00737     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00738 }
00739 
00740 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00741 
00742 {
00743 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00744     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00745 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00746     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00747        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00748        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00749        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00750        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00751        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00752     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00753 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00754 }
00755 
00756 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00757 
00758 {
00759     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00760 
00761     if (!nktimerlat)
00762         return -ENODEV;
00763 
00764     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00765 
00766     return 0;
00767 }
00768 
00769 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00770 
00771 {
00772     int err;
00773 
00774 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00775     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00776        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00777     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00778 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00779 
00780     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00781 
00782     if (err)
00783         return err;
00784 
00785     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00786 
00787     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00788         return -ENOSYS;
00789 
00790     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00791                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00792                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00793                               NULL,
00794                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00795 
00796     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00797 
00798 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00799     err = xnshadow_mount();
00800 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00801 
00802     if (err)
00803         {
00804         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00805         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00806         }
00807 
00808     return err;
00809 }
00810 
00811 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00812 
00813 {
00814 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00815     xnshadow_cleanup();
00816 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00817     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00818     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00819 }
00820 
00821 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00822 
00823 #ifdef __cplusplus
00824 }
00825 #endif
00826 
00827 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00828 
00829 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00830 
00831 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00832 
00833 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
